Connected cars. Smart cities.The Internet of Things (IoT) will forever change the way businesses interact with consumers and each other. Check out the​ Building Data-Driven IoT Applications infographic and discover how you can unlock the impact of IoT on your business with cloud native applications at scale. READ MORE <http://pivotal.io/big-data/infographic/building-iot-applications?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-10-19-15> Pivotal Labs Pivotal's Big €100M Investment In Ireland October 21, 2015
Today, alongside Ireland’s prime minister, the Taoiseach, Enda Kenny TD, and the Minister for Jobs, Enterprise and Innovation, Richard Bruton TD, Pivotal announced a €100M investment plan in Ireland, including a new Pivotal office in Dublin and the creation of 130 new jobs. Similar to many Pivotal Labs locations, Pivotal will also create a software innovation hub for startups and enterprise customers. Read More <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-labs/news/pivotals-big-e100m-investment-in-ireland?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-10-19-15> A Look At Spring Cloud Services For Pivotal Cloud Foundry October 21, 2015
Developing modern software emphasizes loosely coupled services, resilience, ease of scaling and the like. But these attributes do not "come for free". How do you handle things like service discovery, configuration management and the tolerance of service failures? Fortunately, the services to do just that for Spring applications are now an "out of the box" part of Pivotal Cloud Foundry® (PCF). In this episode, we dive a little deeper into each service. Tune In <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal-perspectives/features/a-look-at-spring-cloud-services-for-pivotal-cloud-foundry?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=pov-newsletter-10-19-15> Pivotal Cloud Foundry Spring Cloud Helps Netflix October 20, 2015 Jon Schneider and Taylor Wicksell, senior software engineers at Netflix, spoke about the company’s use of Spring Cloud and its collaboration with Pivotal at the SpringOne2GX conference in Washington, D.C. During an episode of The New Stack Analysts podcast recorded at the conference, Schneider and Wicksell detailed the development of NetflixOSS, the company’s adoption of Cloud Native technologies such as Spring, and the new tools and libraries that Netflix is developing for its open source cloud platform.
